data.title: 2015 Contemporary Film Poster - Chorus, film by Francois Delisle by Sébastien Lépine: (2015) 1st Edition Art / Print / Poster
data.meta_description: 1st Edition - No Binding - 2015 - Condition: Good - Sébastien Lépine is a multi-media artist, designer, and artistic director based in Montreal. His creative pursuits span different mediums including poster art, album artwork, movie posters, video projections for live shows, and music video clips. Lépine has been working as an independent artist since graduating from the graphic design program at Université du Quebec à Montreal in 2000./ Lépine s poster art is characterized by the use of a technique evocative of photomontage: he overlays images and text, creating a striking interplay of transparencies and negative space. A constant stream of music fuels Lépine s creative imagination and vibrant energy is translated into his poster art./ This movie by Montrealer François Delisle tells the story of a divorced couple forced to reunite when the remains of their son are discovered eight years after he went missing when his disappearance was what caused them to separate in the first place. This movie has won several awards at Fünf Seen Film Festival and Indianapolis International Film Festival, as well as having been nominated at the Sundance Film Festival./ This silkscreen poster was hand-printed by the artist himself and is in excellent condition. This poster measures 24 x 34 inches. - 2015 Contemporary Film Poster - Chorus, film by Francois Delisle
data.text:
About this Item

Sébastien Lépine is a multi-media artist, designer, and artistic director based in Montreal. His creative pursuits span different mediums including poster art, album artwork, movie posters, video projections for live shows, and music video clips. Lépine has been working as an independent artist since graduating from the graphic design program at Université du Quebec à Montreal in 2000./ Lépine s poster art is characterized by the use of a technique evocative of photomontage: he overlays images and text, creating a striking interplay of transparencies and negative space. A constant stream of music fuels Lépine s creative imagination and vibrant energy is translated into his poster art./ This movie by Montrealer François Delisle tells the story of a divorced couple forced to reunite when the remains of their son are discovered eight years after he went missing when his disappearance was what caused them to separate in the first place. This movie has won several awards at Fünf Seen Film Festival and Indianapolis International Film Festival, as well as having been nominated at the Sundance Film Festival./ This silkscreen poster was hand-printed by the artist himself and is in excellent condition. This poster measures 24 x 34 inches. Seller Inventory # SL008

Contact seller

Report this item

L'Affichiste is Montreal's only vintage poster gallery. With an inventory of over 5,000 posters and non-reproduction prints, the gallery has something for everyone, at every price point. We work with individuals, institutions and museums around the world and are members of the International Vintage Poster Dealer Association.

Visit Seller's Storefront

Seller's business information

L'Affichiste Vintage Posters

QC, Canada

Terms of Sale:

We guarantee the condition of every poster as it's described on the Abebooks web sites. If

your order hasn't arrived, you're eligible for a refund within 30 days of the estimated delivery

date. If you've changed your mind about a book that you've ordered, please use the Ask

bookseller a question link to contact us and we'll respond within 2 business days.

Shipping Terms:

Orders usually ship within 2-3 business days. Shipping costs are based weights and we use international postal services, with tracking (and signature, when available). Insurance fees are additional, and if you would prefer that we use an alternative carrier, like UPS or FedEx, please let us know at time of purchase and we will estimate shipping costs with those carriers. We are not responsible for shipping delays or customs charges. We will not under-declare a value of a poster for shipping purposes.
